data.scheme_name: Karnataka IT Policy 2020 - 2025 - Reimbursements of PF/ESI - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides reimbursement Rs 0.02 lakhs per employee per month of Provident Fund (PF)/Employee’s State Insurance (ESI) for 2 years with a ceiling of Rs.24 lakhs.
data.eligibility: IT/ITeS entities having a registered office in Karnataka under the Companies Act (1956/2013), Partnership Act (1932), LLP Act (2008), or the Karnataka Shops & Commercial Establishment Act (1961).
data.conditions:
Entities must be registered with KITS/Department.
The Applicant shall avail the incentive only once during the policy period.
The incentive is available outside of Zone 3.
data.beneficiaries: IT/ITeS entities having a registered office in Karnataka under the Companies Act (1956/2013), Partnership Act (1932), LLP Act (2008), or the Karnataka Shops & Commercial Establishment Act (1961).
data.prerequisites:
An applicant can apply for reimbursement of Provident Fund (PF)/Employee’s State Insurance (ESI) for the technical employment created during the policy period and for the employee that is for a continuous period of 2 years. 

Reimbursement shall be made on actuals. In case the employer’s contribution is less than Rs.2,000 the actual amount of employer’s contribution will be reimbursed. 

Applicants can avail the benefit only once during the policy period.

Employment data will be verified through Provident Fund/Employees State Insurance Departments.

The incentive is available outside of Zone 3.
data.context: Government of Karnataka (GoK) has formulated Karnataka's IT Policy for the period 2020 - 2025 with a focus on the continued development of infrastructure, markets, ecosystem, talent and ease of doing business to support the growth of the IT industry.
data.objective:
The main objective is to promote and support Digital (IT, ESDM, Innovation and Allied) Industry growth and Investments in Karnataka. 

To provide handholding services and assist in preparation of Technology - sector specific investment reports for respective stakeholders. 

To Act like Bridge between Industry and the Government for promoting the technology Industry in Karnataka and to build the brand equity of the State and enhance its leadership position across all key segments.
data.description: Scheme provides reimbursement Rs. 2000 per employee per month for 2 years for only new technical employment generated during the policy period with a ceiling of Rs 24 lakhs.
data.how_to_apply:
Applicant can register from below site
http://ktech.amareatechsolutions.com/login
data.funding_mechanism: Fund/Incentive will be released on approval of application by the concerned authority after fulfilment of condition.
data.additional_info:
The talukas in Karnataka are classified into zones to ensure a strong industrial base with equitable allocation of funds. The State is classified into three Zones namely Zone 1, Zone 2 and Zone 3 as per the prevailing Karnataka Industrial Policy. 

Zone 1 : Holalkere, Channagiri, Jagalur, Honnali, Gudibande, Bagepalli, Chikkaballapura, Srinivasapura, Soraba, Hosanagara, Shikaripura, Madhugiri, Koratagere, Gubbi, Pavagada, Chikkanayakanahalli, Yelandur, Gundlupet, Hanur, Chamarajanagar, Kollegal, Arakalgud, Belur, Arasikere, Madikeri, Somwarpet, Virajpet, Ponnampete, Kushalnagar, Bilagi, Badami, Mudhol, Jamkhandi, Hunagund, Guledgudda, Rabakavi - Banahatti, Terdal, Ilkal, Bagalkote, Bailhongal, Soundathi, Chikkodi, Raibag, Khanapur, Ramdurg, Hukkeri, Athani, Gokak, Nippani, Kagavadi, Mudalgi, Yaragatti, Kittur, Belagavi, Sindgi, Indi, Muddebihal, B Bagewadi, Alamela, Babaleshwar, Nidagundi, Tikota, Chedachana, Kolhar, Devarahipparagi, Talikote, Vijayapura, Navalgund, Kalghatagi, Kundaghol, Annigeri, Alnavar, Hubballi (R), Dharwada, Hubballi(U), Mundargi, Nargund, Ron, Shrirahatti, Gajaendragad, Lakshmeshwar, Gadag, Savanur, Shiggaon, Hirekurur, Hanagal, Ranebennur, Byadagi, Rattihalli, Haveri, Honnavar, Sirsi, Mundagod, Yellapura, Siddapura, Haliyal, Joida, Bhatkal, Ankola, Kumta, Dandeli, Karwar, H B Halli, Hadagalli, Kudligi, Hosepet, Sandur, Siraguppa, Harappana Halli, Kurogod, Kottur, Kampli, Bellary, Bhalki, Humnabad, Basava Kalyana, Aurad, Chitaguppa, Hulusur, Kamala Nagar, Bidar, Afzalpur, Aland, Jewargi, Sedam, Chittapur, Chincholi, Kalagi, Kamalapur, Yedrami, Shahabad, Kalaburagi, Yadgir, Shahapur, Shorapur, Hunasagi, Vadagera, Gurumitkal, Kushtagi, Yelburga, Gangavathi, Kukkunur, Karatagi, Kanakagiri, Koppal, Sindhanur, Manvi, Lingasugur, Devadurga, Maski, Siravara, Raichur 

Zone 2 : Magadi, Ramanagara, Channapatna, Kanakapura, Harohalli, Hiriyur, Chitradurga, Challakere, Hosadurga, Molkalmuru, Davanagere, Harihar, Nyamati, Chintamani, Gowribidanur, Siddlaghatta, Cheluru, Bangarpet, KGF, Kolar, Malur, Mulbagal, Sagar, Thirthahalli, Shivamogga, Bhadravathi, Turuvekere, Sira, Tiptur, Kunigal, Tumakur, Kadur, Mudigere, Tarikere, Chickamagalur, Ajjampur, Shringeri, Koppa, NR Pura, Kalasa, Bantwal, Sulya, Belthangadi, Puttur, Mulki, Ullal, Moodbidri, Kadaba, Mangalore, Alur, C R Patna, Shantigrama, Hassan, H N Pura, Saklespura, Srirangapatna, Pandavapura, Mandya, Maddur, Nagamangala, Malavalli, K R Pet, Hunsur, K R Nagara, Mysuru, Nanjangud, T N Pura, Periyapatna, HD Kote, Saraguru, Saligrama, Karkala, Bhramhavara, Udupi, Kundapura, Kapu, Hebri, Baindur. 

Zone 3 : Anekal, Bengaluru(N), Bengaluru(S), Yelahanka, Bengaluru(E), Devanahalli, Doddaballapura, Hoskote, Nelamangala. 

Fees structure for registration/provisional registration certificate with KITS/Department and this is non - refundable : 

IT/ITeS Entities = Rs. 10, 000/ - + (18% GST) 

Infrastructure Developer = Rs. 10, 000/ - + (18% GST) 

One - time application processing fee for availing benefits under Karnataka IT Policy 2020 - 25 : 

IT Hubs/Clusters, Co - working Spaces/Plug and Play Infrastructure = Rs. 20, 000/ - + (18% GST) 

Lease/Rental Reimbursement, Exemption on Stamp Duty, Power Tariff Concession, Quality Certification Cost Reimbursement, Marketing Cost Reimbursement, Reimbursements of PF/ESI, Patents Cost Reimbursement & R&D Support = Rs. 10, 000/ - + (18% GST)
data.checklist_info_a:
i. Application form for ‘Quality Certification Cost Reimbursement’ in the prescribed 
format provided in Section 4.7
ii. Signed Undertaking in the prescribed format provided in Section 5.3
iii. Copy of the KITS Registration Certificate as stated in Section 2
iv. Self-Declaration regarding employment in the prescribed format provided in Section 
5.10
v. Self-attested copy of the Industry Standard Quality Certifications application form 
submitted for a product/service, along with payment receipts
vi. Self-attested copy of the Industry Standard Quality Certificates
vii. Self-attested copy of statement of expenditure with invoices and receipts 
viii.For reimbursement for ISO Certificate - Self-attested copy of the ISO Certificate 
obtained from NABCB accredited agencies
data.checklist_info_b:
Applicant can register from below site
IT BT (amareatechsolutions.com)
data.checklist_info_d:
Address : Room No. 602, 6th Floor, MS Building Bengaluru - 1
E-Mail ID : itbtsec@karnataka.gov.in
Phone No : 080-22280562
